name: AndroidSigning
description: Sign and align Android APK files
author: Microsoft Corporation
releaseNotes: This version of the task uses apksigner instead of jarsigner to sign APKs.

inputs.name: files
inputs.label: APK files
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path from the repo root to the APK(s) you want to sign. You can use wildcards to specify multiple files ([more information](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=856077)). For example, `**/bin/*.apk` for all .APK files in the 'bin' subfolder

inputs.name: apksign
inputs.label: Sign the APK
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this option to sign the APK with a provided keystore file. Unsigned APKs can only run in an emulator. APKs must be signed to run on a device.

inputs.name: keystoreFile
inputs.label: Keystore file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the keystore file that was uploaded to `Secure Files` to be used to sign the APK.

inputs.name: keystorePass
inputs.label: Keystore password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the password for the provided keystore file. Use a new variable with its lock enabled on the Variables tab to encrypt this value.

inputs.name: keystoreAlias
inputs.label: Alias
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the alias that identifies the public/private key pair to be used in the keystore file.

inputs.name: keyPass
inputs.label: Key password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the key password for the alias and keystore file. Use a new variable with its lock enabled on the Variables tab to encrypt this value.

inputs.name: apksignerArguments
inputs.label: apksigner arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide any options to pass to the apksigner command line. Default is: -verbose -sigalg MD5withRSA -digestalg SHA1

inputs.name: apksignerLocation
inputs.label: apksigner location
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally specify the location of the apksigner executable used during signing. This defaults to the apksigner found in the Android SDK version folder that your application builds against.

inputs.name: zipalign
inputs.label: Zipalign
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select if you want to zipalign your package. This reduces the amount of RAM consumed by an app.

inputs.name: zipalignLocation
inputs.label: Zipalign location
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally specify the location of the zipalign executable used during signing. This defaults to the zipalign found in the Android SDK version folder that your application builds against.

messages.AndroidHomeNotSet: The ANDROID_HOME environment variable is not set for the running user.

messages.NoMatchingFiles: No matching files were found with search pattern: %s
